resources.string: Content is supposed to be here. If you are seeing this, please go back and try again.

By using SMSLocator, you agree that you have read and understand the following:[br][br]SMSLocator may send text messages.[br][br]These messages are ONLY sent in response to messages that are addressed to SMSLocator using your keyword.[br][br]Due to the nature of SMSLocator, it is [i]not[/i] possible to review these message before sending. They can be seen after, however.[br][br]SMSLocator may send your device\'s location over text message when requested and when user authentication occurs.[br][br]SMSLocator does not store or send your personal information.

SMSLocator requires admin privileges in order to function. Having these privileges prevents uninstalling of the app, which means you will need to disable SMSLocator before uninstalling the app. SMSLocator requests permission to lock your phone, so that the \'lock\' command can be run. In addition, the password reset permission is used to change your device PIN on your request.
Your keyword should contain letters, numbers, and symbols. Spaces are not allowed.
Do you want to remove or edit the number\u0020

Welcome to SMSLocator! To start using the app, simply tap the button labeled \"Enable SMSLocator\". By default, you won\'t be able to access the extra commands and Google Maps links will not be sent. To enable these features, please purchase the premium upgrade!

By upgrading SMSLocator to the premium version, you will get access to all the commands, Google Maps links will be sent along with device coordinates, and ads will be removed. Thank you for supporting the app and myself!

You\'re almost done! Now, all that\'s left for you to do is set your keyword. Once you do that, you\'re all set! To see what commands are available, and how to format them, check out the Commands help section.
It seems that you\'re using an ad blocker on this device. To use SMSLocator, please disable it or purchase premium. If you believe this message is in error, please contact support.

SMSLocator is being removed from Google Play on December 31, 2018 due to new restrictions from Google. For this reason, the premium upgrade can no longer be purchased. See www.smslocator.net for more info.
Would you like to clear the list of interactions? This can\'t be undone.
Success! You have unlocked premium for 7 days. Expiry:
Uh-oh! We\'re having trouble accessing the Google Play store. Please double-check your internet connection then try again.
Please confirm your pin to change this setting.
Please confirm your pin to disable SMSLocator.
You did not grant SMSLocator admin permissions. This is required in order to use premium features. Please enable SMSLocator again and accept the admin request.
Please choose a pin. You MUST remember this in order to change SMSLocator settings
Revoking admin permissions will disable SMSLocator. Continue?
Enter your pin to confirm keyword change.
Premium purchase has been restored. All features unlocked!
Enable "SMSLocator" on this page to allow Do-Not-Disturb control. When done, press back.
Error decoding pin! Please try again.
Pins don\'t match or are empty! Please try again.

Whoops! This is embarrassingâ€¦ Looks like either this shouldn\'t be here, we didn\'t add the help info yet, or you just found a bug! Please go back and try again. If this issue persists, please email support.
PIN is either empty or too short. Please try again.
An error occurred while attempting purchase.
Permission(s) not granted! These are required for the app to work.
Keyword not set. Please try again!
Some or all permissions were permanently denied. Please enable them in your settings in order to use SMSLocator.
A message has been sent to\u0020
When SMS Locator sends a message, a message will be placed in the notification bar.
Maximum time a location is valid.
Sets how important the notifications are. High and above will show heads-up notifications (Lollipop only)
Sets how long the device tries to get a new location before sending an old one
